com.github.maxstupo.jflatlog

Class JFlatLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.maxstupo.jflatlog.JFlatLog

  • public class JFlatLog
extends java.lang.Object
    JFlatLog is a lightweight logger that supports both log-to-file and log-to-console.
    Author:
    Maxstupo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Critical errors.

      Warnings.

      The tag/category for the logger, this is used for exceptions.
      static java.lang.String TIMESTAMP_FORMAT_CONSOLE
      The default time format for console.
      static java.lang.String TIMESTAMP_FORMAT_LOGFILE
      The default time format for log files.

      • LEVEL_OFF

        public static final int LEVEL_OFF
        Disable logging.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEVEL_SEVERE

        public static final int LEVEL_SEVERE
        Critical errors. The application will no longer work correctly.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEVEL_ERROR

        public static final int LEVEL_ERROR
        Errors. The application may no longer work correctly.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEVEL_WARN

        public static final int LEVEL_WARN
        Warnings. The application may no longer work correctly.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEVEL_INFO

        public static final int LEVEL_INFO
        Informative messages. Sometimes used for release build.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEVEL_DEBUG

        public static final int LEVEL_DEBUG
        Debug messages. This level is useful during development.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int LEVEL_FINE
        A lot of information is logged.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JFlatLog

        public JFlatLog()
        Create a new logger without log-to-file capabilities.

        Use initLogging(File, boolean) to give log-to-file capabilities.

      • JFlatLog

        public JFlatLog(java.io.File logFile,
                boolean appendLog)
        Create a new logger with log-to-file capabilities.

        Note: This constructor is equivalent to calling the default constructor and then calling initLogging(File, boolean)

        Parameters:
        logFile - See getLogFile() for details.
        appendLog - See isAppendLog() for details.

    • Method Detail

      • initLogging

        public void initLogging(java.io.File logFile,
                        boolean appendLog)
        Initializes logging to file capabilities.
        Parameters:
        logFile - See getLogFile() for details.
        appendLog - See isAppendLog() for details.

      • log

        public void log(int level,
                java.lang.String tag,
                java.lang.String category,
                java.lang.String message,
                java.lang.Throwable ex,
                boolean disableLogToFile,
                java.lang.Object... args)
        Logs the given message to console and/or file.
        Parameters:
        level - the log level.
        tag - the tag of the message.
        category - the category of the message.
        message - the message.
        ex - the exception that invoked this message.
        disableLogToFile - true to disable this message from being logged into the log file.
        args - objects to replace {0},{1},etc....

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the writer to the log file. This call is ignored if the logger doesn't have logging capabilities.

      • setLoggingToFile

        public void setLoggingToFile(boolean isLoggingToFile)
        If the given value is true the logger will write, all log messages to file, only if this logger hasLoggingCapabilities() if it doesn't, use initLogging(File, boolean) first.
        Parameters:
        isLoggingToFile - If true will log messages to file.

      • setLogfileTimestampFormat

        public void setLogfileTimestampFormat(java.lang.String logfileTimestampFormat)
        Sets the format used for the log files.
        Parameters:
        logfileTimestampFormat - the format used for the log files.

      • setConsoleTimestampFormat

        public void setConsoleTimestampFormat(java.lang.String consoleTimestampFormat)
        Sets the format for the console time.
        Parameters:
        consoleTimestampFormat - the format.

      • setLogFormatHandler

        public void setLogFormatHandler(ILogFormatHandler logFormatHandler)
        The format handler for logging to a file. This allows log messages to be logged in different formats.
        Parameters:
        logFormatHandler - The interface for formatting messages that get logged to file.

      • setLogLevel

        public void setLogLevel(int logLevel)
        Set the logging level, any level bellow this value will not be logged.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - the log level.

      • isAppendLog

        public boolean isAppendLog()
        If true the logger will append log entries into the file, instead of creating a new file with a timestamp. This variable is readonly and is set from initLogging(File, boolean) or JFlatLog(File, boolean)
        Returns:
        true if the logger will append log entries into the file.

      • isLoggingToFile

        public boolean isLoggingToFile()
        Returns true if the logger is logging to the log file.
        Returns:
        true if the logger is logging to the log file.

      • hasLoggingCapabilities

        public boolean hasLoggingCapabilities()
        Returns true if initLogging(File, boolean) method has been called.
        Returns:
        true if initLogging(File, boolean) method has been called.

      • getLogFormatHandler

        public ILogFormatHandler getLogFormatHandler()
        Returns:
        See setLogFormatHandler(ILogFormatHandler) for details.

      • getLogfileTimestampFormat

        public java.lang.String getLogfileTimestampFormat()
        Returns the time format for logfile names.
        Returns:
        the time format for logfile names.

      • getConsoleTimestampFormat

        public java.lang.String getConsoleTimestampFormat()
        Returns the console format for time.
        Returns:
        the console format for time.

      • getLogLevel

        public int getLogLevel()
        Returns:
        See setLogLevel(int) for details.

      • getLogFile

        public java.io.File getLogFile()
        The file path the logger will log to.
        Returns:
        a file object where the logger will be logging to.

      • get

        public static final JFlatLog get()
        Returns a logger for logging to console only, use initLogging(File, boolean) to allow this instance to log-to-file.
        Returns:
        a logger instance.
        See Also:
        hasLoggingCapabilities()
